channel.title: Updates: USDA Food Purchases [Records Request]
channel.description: Updates on the Data Liberation Project's USDA Food Purchases request

item.title: Second Set of Records Provided
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On June 28, 2024, the USDA provided ðŸ“„ a “second supplemental response” of 757 pages of records. The agency says it is reviewing additional records for disclosure.

item.title: Initial Records Provided
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On April 19, 2024, the USDA provided ðŸ“„ a “first supplemental response” of 356 pages of records. The agency says it is reviewing additional records for disclosure.

item.title: Denial Appealed
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On November 28, 2023, the Cornell Law School First Amendment Clinic sent the USDA a letter appealing the denial ðŸ“„, focusing on the withholding of the documentation records sought in the second part of the request. The appeal was acknowledged by the agency on November 29, 2023, and assigned the tracking number 2024-AMS-00001-A.

item.title: Request Denied
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On September 1, 2023, the USDA emailed a letter fully denying access to the requested records ðŸ“„. The agency argues that the first part of the request “lacks specificity”, and is withholding all records sought by the second part of the request under FOIA exemptions (b)(3) and (b)(7)(E).

item.title: Request Acknowledged, Fee Waiver Granted
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On December 20, 2022, an AMS FOIA officer sent an email acknowledging our request ðŸ“„ and noting, “we have determined that your fee waiver request does sufficiently meet all of the criteria under the FOIA and the applicable regulations; therefore, your request for a fee waiver is approved.”
